member.name: T:Autodesk.Connectivity.JobProcessor.Extensibility.IJob
member.summary: A Job from from the queue.

member.name: T:Autodesk.Connectivity.JobProcessor.Extensibility.IJobHandler
member.summary: The interface that Job Handlers must implement.

member.name: T:Autodesk.Connectivity.JobProcessor.Extensibility.IJobProcessorServices
member.summary: Utilities for interfacing with the application.

member.name: P:Autodesk.Connectivity.JobProcessor.Extensibility.IJob.Description
member.summary: Gets the description of the job.

member.name: P:Autodesk.Connectivity.JobProcessor.Extensibility.IJob.Id
member.summary: Gets the unique ID.

member.name: P:Autodesk.Connectivity.JobProcessor.Extensibility.IJob.JobType
member.summary: Gets the job type.

member.name: P:Autodesk.Connectivity.JobProcessor.Extensibility.IJob.Params
member.summary: Gets the set of parameters on the job.

member.name: P:Autodesk.Connectivity.JobProcessor.Extensibility.IJob.Priority
member.summary: Gets the priority of the job. Lower number means higher priorty. 1 is the highest priority. Less than 1 is not allowed.

member.name: P:Autodesk.Connectivity.JobProcessor.Extensibility.IJob.VaultName
member.summary: Gets the Vault that the Job references.

member.name: M:Autodesk.Connectivity.JobProcessor.Extensibility.IJobHandler.CanProcess(System.String)
member.summary: Called at Job Processor startup to determine whither or not a job of the specified type can be processed by the job handler on this particular machine. Implementations should check to see whether enabling software is installed.
member.returns: True if the handler can process the job. False if the handler cannot process the job.

member.name: M:Autodesk.Connectivity.JobProcessor.Extensibility.IJobHandler.Execute(Autodesk.Connectivity.JobProcessor.Extensibility.IJobProcessorServices,Autodesk.Connectivity.JobProcessor.Extensibility.IJob)
member.summary: The Execute method processes the job and returns success or failure

member.name: M:Autodesk.Connectivity.JobProcessor.Extensibility.IJobHandler.OnJobProcessorShutdown(Autodesk.Connectivity.JobProcessor.Extensibility.IJobProcessorServices)
member.summary: Called when the Job Processor is closing.

member.name: M:Autodesk.Connectivity.JobProcessor.Extensibility.IJobHandler.OnJobProcessorSleep(Autodesk.Connectivity.JobProcessor.Extensibility.IJobProcessorServices)
member.summary: Called when the Job Processor process is about to sleep.

member.name: M:Autodesk.Connectivity.JobProcessor.Extensibility.IJobHandler.OnJobProcessorStartup(Autodesk.Connectivity.JobProcessor.Extensibility.IJobProcessorServices)
member.summary: Called at Job Processor startup.

member.name: M:Autodesk.Connectivity.JobProcessor.Extensibility.IJobHandler.OnJobProcessorWake(Autodesk.Connectivity.JobProcessor.Extensibility.IJobProcessorServices)
member.summary: Called when the Job Processor process wakes from sleeping.

member.summary: Lets the application know how close to completion the job is.
member.param: How close to completion the job is.

member.summary: Logs a message.

member.summary: Logs an exception.

member.summary: Gets / Sets if it's allowed to retry the job in case of failure.

member.summary: Gets a Connection object for communicating with the servers.

member.summary: Gets the list of all errors logged so far.

member.name: P:Autodesk.Connectivity.JobProcessor.Extensibility.IJobProcessorServices.InventorObject
member.summary: Gets an object which could be force cast to type Inventor.InventorServer and used like Inventor.Application. This object should be initialized and released by framework. Extension developer doesn't need to take care of that.

member.summary: The outcome of the Job processing.

member.summary: The type of logging message.
